result.execSummary:
Flint E Fleming was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Flint E Fleming was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The Court received a "Motion for Habeas Corpus" from the DE in this matter on 8-19-15. After reviewing the motion, the Court finds no grounds for an evidentiary hearing or further review. DE's Motion is DENIED.
Motion Habeas Corpus, filed by DE.
Order granting Motion to Withdraw. Atty Rios is withdrawn as counsel for DE. Successor counsel will be appointed by the SPD.
Motion to Withdraw, filed by Atty Rios.
of remand-upon State of WI Governor's Warrant.

Cont'd Extradition Hearing. State submits Governor's Warrant. Asking bail revoked and remanded to State of AZ. Atty Rios requests 30 adys to commense action for Habeas Corpus. Crt reviews statute. Ask Atty Rios why 30 days. Rios asks until 8/31. Crt makes findings. ALlows def until 8/21/15 for writ of filing Habeas Corpus. Cash bail revoked. Taken into custody.
Extradition hearing on August 5, 2015 at 11:00 am.

State appears by district attorney Paul W. Humphrey. Defendant in court with counsel attorney Anthony Rios. State gives update. This is a 30 day hearing on the 90 days for a Govenor warrant from the state of Arizona. Requesting extension for 55 days. Defense agrees with States recommendation. Court grants. Bail modification reqested and court grants. Bond form signed.

- $2500.00 cash bail previously posted
- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin except to attend court proceedings.
Extradition hearing on June 16, 2015 at 09:00 am.

- Defendant shall not use or possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Defendant shall not leave the State of Wisconsin except to attend court proceedings.
